page.title: 02FARMING IN STAMBOURNE 1
page.content: Farms in this area are divided into three types. 1)Large solely arable 2)Small solely arable 3)Small mixed, that is arable and animals. The size of farms varies from 40 to 2000 acres. As some of the smaller farms, under 150 acres, do not provide an adequate income, some of the owners of these units supplement their income with a second occupation. The usual alternative is to do contract work for another farmer. Others do haulage work and one is a bus driver. The crops grown are wheat, barley, beans, peas, oilseed rape, durum wheat and sugar beet. Oilseed rape is only grown on large farms. Sugar beet is only grown on one large farm and a field of durum wheat was grown on one large farm for the first time this year.
